Agri10x is India\'s largest B2B E-Marketplace for farmers with integrated quality assaying and warehouse modules
What are the charges for registration?
We do not charge any registration fee; it is absolutely free of cost.
Who is eligible to sell commodities on Agri10x?
All the users whose KYC is verified are eligible to sell on Agri10x.
What are the payment options on Agri10x?
We support only cashless transactions on our portal.
For registering complaints and grievance, what is the customer support number?
Please call on 1800 121 2243 to register your complaints/grievances.

This Privacy Policy (“Policy”) establishes uniform, global guidance regarding how iCognitive Global Private Limited (“Agri10x” or “Company”) intends generally to Process (as defined below) and protect Personal Data (as defined below). This Policy explains how Agri10x may collect, use and disclose Personal Information (as defined below) that has been obtained through its web-based application (“Platform”), from the communications with the Company and/or from third parties. It also describes the choices available to the Data Subjects (as defined below) regarding the use of, access to, and how to update and correct their Personal Information. 

This Policy should not be construed as a guarantee of action by the Company or as creating contractually binding promises. To the extent that Law (as defined below) or contractual provisions impose stricter requirements than the guidance set forth below, the Company will comply with the more restrictive Law or contractual provisions. Adherence to this Policy may be limited to the extent required to respond to legal, governmental or regulatory requirements, or where expressly permitted by Law. 

This Privacy Policy forms part and parcel of the Platform’s terms and conditions (“Terms of Use”) which is included therein by this reference. The capitalized terms which have been used herein but are not specifically defined shall have the same meaning as attributed to such term in the Terms and Conditions. The Terms and Conditions and this Privacy Policy are to be interpreted harmoniously at all events. 

Further, this Policy does not replace or supersede any other privacy statement, privacy policy, or other notice or agreement addressing the Processing by the Company of Personal Data issued or otherwise made available to Data Subjects, but rather, shall be read in conjunction with such statements, policies, notices or agreements; provided, however, that in the event of a conflict between such statements, policies, notices or agreements and this Policy, the provisions of the latter shall govern. 

In case the Data Subjects do not agree to the terms of this Policy in their entirety, they may not access or otherwise use the Platform or site offerings.



SCOPE AND ELIGIBILITY 

This Policy applies to the Processing of Personal Data of Company’s current and former employees, buyers, farmer producer organizations (“FPOs”), farmers and traders and/or any person accessing any Platform. POLICY


1. DEFINITIONS 

2. COLLECTION OF PERSONAL DATA 

2.1. General Statement: The Company insists upon the highest standards for secure transactions and information privacy. The Company collects Personal Data for identified and appropriate business purposes, or as may otherwise be required or permitted by Law and does not Process Personal Data in ways that conflict with those purposes, unless otherwise required or permitted by Law. 

2.2. Personal Information Collected by the Company: The Personal Data that the Company may collect and Process includes, to the extent applicable to the relevant Data Subject: personal and business contact information (including name, home address, work address or location, phone number, and email address); financial information (including bank account and/or salary details); emergency contact information; beneficiary information; recruitment, pre-employment and employment information, including background checks, employment history, educational history, career profiles, attendance records, performance appraisals, corrective actions, benefits-related information and information concerning retirement, resignation, and other types of termination; job title and description, date of hire, working status, employment hours and any written agreements between the Employee and the Company; information relating to work-related claims, internal investigations and disciplinary proceedings; information held for employment law and health and safety purposes; communications data and other data stored on, or transmitted through, the Company’s Information Resources (including phone call logs, emails, and internet browsing history); image and/or voice, which may be captured through photographs, video recordings, audio recordings and/or similar media; driver’s license information; business travel and expense reporting information; Sensitive Identification Data and Sensitive Personal Data; and other similar information. 

2.3. Personal Information provided by the Data Subject 

The Company collects and stores Personal Information which is provided by the Data Subject from time to time, including pursuant to use of the Platform of the Company. The primary goal in collection of Personal Information is to provide a safe, efficient, smooth and customized experience to the Data Subject. This allows the Company to provide services and features that most likely meet the needs of the Data Subject. The Company collects Personal Information when the Data Subject chooses to provide it to the Company, including but not limited to when the Data Subject:
 
a) register to use the Platform; 
b) purchase a product on the Platform; 
c) use the Platform; 
d) review one of the products or post content to public pages on the Platform; 
e) communicate with the Company via the Platform or via email; and/or 
f) sign up to receive marketing information about the products and services. 

The Company may also collect information at other points on the Platform with the Data Subject’s consent and with notice to them. Please note that the Company may use third party service providers to help operate the Platform and to provide analytical data with respect to the Platform of the Company and these third-party service providers may collect Personal Information from the Platform for these purposes. 

Registering of an Account: The Platform gives the option of creating a user account (“Account”) as a farmer, trader, FPO and buyer. If the Data Subject decides to create an Account, they will provide the Company with certain Personal Information, such as first and last name, email address and password, phone number, business name, commodity interested in, location, crop name, selling month and quantity and any other information regarding seller and buyer. The Data Subjects are not required to register to use the Platform. However, the Company collects personally identifiable information (email address, name, phone number, credit card / debit card / other payment instrument details, etc.) from the Data Subject when they set up a free account. While the Data Subject can browse some sections of Company’s Platform without being a registered member, certain activities (such as placing an order) do require registration. The Company also uses contact information to send offers based on previous orders and interests of the Data Subjects. The Company will have access to SMS, contacts in directory, location and device information and the Company may request the Data Subject to provide requisite KYC document (such as PAN and Aadhaar) details to check eligibility for certain products/services including but not limited to providing credit) being offered by the Company, its affiliates or its lending partners. The Company may share this data with its affiliates or its lending partners for the same purposes stated in this Policy. In the event that consent to this, such use of data is withdrawn in the future, the Company will stop collection of such data but continue to store the data excluding Aadhaar information and use it for internal purposes to further improve its services. 

Purchasing an Agri10x Product: The Data Subject purchasing an Agri10x product using the Platform, they are given the option of logging into an Account or, if they do not already have an Account, creating a new Account. In either case, when the Data Subject purchases an Agri10x, the Company collects some additional information, such as billing address, a credit / debit card number and a credit / debit card expiration date and/ or other payment instrument details and tracking information from cheques or money orders. 

Making Payment: The Data Subject while making payment through use of the Platform, they will need to provide Personal Information to Company’s third-party payment processors. Such Personal Information may include Sensitive Information, such as credit card number, expiry date and security code. This information is not collected by Agri10x but is provided directly by the Data Subject to Company’s third-party payment processors and its collection, use and disclosure is governed by their privacy policies. The Company encourages the Data Subjects to review the privacy policies of Company’s third-party payment processors. 
Submitting Information to the Website: The Company collects information, including Personal Information that is submitted by the Data Subject to the Platform. This includes any text, images, videos, photographs, messages and comments on message boards, product reviews and customer testimonials. If they choose to post content such as a product review i.e., where content can be viewed by all users with or without user accounts, the Platform will collect the information submitted to the Platform and the information contained in their posting will be visible to others, including any Personal Information they choose to include. The Company cannot control who reads the postings or what other users may do with the information that they voluntarily post, so it is very important that they do not put Personal Information in the posts if they do not want it to be seen or used by others. Please keep this in mind when submitting content to any public area of the Platform. The Company reserves the right to use any product reviews or customer testimonials for its marketing and promotional purposes, so please take this into consideration while choosing to include Personal Information in the product reviews or testimonials. 

Social Media Websites: If Data Subject engages in any interaction with Agri10x, other Platform users or any third-party on any Agri10x social media account pages (“Social Media Pages”), they should be aware that: (a) the Personal Information that is submitted by and through such Social Media Pages can be read, collected and/or used by other users of those Platforms/services (depending on their privacy settings associated with their accounts with the applicable social media websites), and could be used to send unsolicited messages or otherwise to contact them without their consent or desire; and (b) where Agri10x responds to any interaction on such Social Media Pages, their account name/handle may be viewable by any and all members/users of Agri10x’s social media accounts. The Company is not responsible for the Personal Information that the Data Subject chooses to submit on any Social Media Pages. Their interactions with the Social Media Pages are governed by the privacy policies of the applicable social media websites. The Company encourages them to review the privacy policies and settings of the Social Media Pages with which they interact to help them understand privacy practices of those social media websites. 

Communicating with us: The Company may also collect Personal Information from the Data Subject when they communicate with the Company. For example, they may send Personal Information by an email, subscribing to the Agri10x email list or through the Platform contact form. If they contact via the Platform, the Company will require their full name and email address. They also have the choice to provide with their city, state/province, and any other information they choose to provide. The Company will keep a record of that correspondence in order to respond to the enquiries and to process the requests.


3. PASSIVE COLLECTION OF TECHNICAL INFORMATION 

Computer IP Addresses/Browser Type: The Company may collect certain non-personally identifiable information about the Data Subject and their desktop computer when they visit many of the pages of the Platform. This non-personally identifiable information includes, without limitation, the type of browser that they use (e.g., Safari, Chrome, Internet Explorer), their IP address, the type of operating system that they use (e.g., Windows or iOS) and the domain name of their Internet service provider (e.g., Verizon, AT&T). The Company uses the non-personally identifiable information that it collects to improve the design and content of the Platform offerings and to enable it to personalize their Internet experience. 

Behavioural Tracking: The Company while conducting optional online surveys may ask the Data Subject for contact information and demographic information (like zip code, age, or income level). The Company uses this data to tailor their experience while using the Platform, providing them with content that the Company thinks they might be interested in and to display content according to their preferences. Agri10x and its third-party partners use Cookies (as defined below), pixels and other tracking technology (collectively, “Tracking Technology”) to analyse trends, administer the Platform, track users’ movements around the Platform and to gather demographic information about Agri10x user base as a whole. Agri10x third-party partners may use Tracking Technology to gather information about the Data Subject activities on the Platform and other websites in order to provide them with certain Agri10x advertising based upon their browsing activities and interests. The Company shall not be responsible for the tracking practices of third parties in connection with the Platform. Lastly, users may be able to opt-out of this form of tracking utilizing. Please note that opting out of this tracking activity does not opt them out of being served advertising. Even where they opt out of this tracking activity, they will continue to receive generic advertisements. 

Cross Device Tracking: The Company provides the use of the Platform offerings across various devices, including Data Subject’s personal computer and mobile device, in order to optimize and personalize their Platform offerings experience. The Company may collect certain of their Personal Information across various devices. Please be advised that where they opt-out of having their use of the Platform offerings tracked across devices, they may need to upload certain information multiple times and/or input their log-in information multiple times. 

Cookies: “Cookies” are small files placed on the hard drive that assist in providing the services. The Company offers certain features that are only available through the use of a “cookie”. It also uses cookies to allow the Data Subject to enter their password less frequently during a session. Cookies can also help the Company in providing information that is targeted to the Data Subject’s interests. Most cookies are “session cookies,” meaning that they are automatically deleted from the hard drive at the end of a session. Data Subjects are always free to decline cookies if their browser permits, although in that case they may not be able to use certain features on the said Platform and they may be required to re-enter their password more frequently during a session. Additionally, they may encounter “cookies” or other similar devices on certain pages of the said Platform that are placed by third parties. The Company does not control the use of cookies by third parties. The Company may also collect Personal Data automatically about Data Subject using cookies or other similar tracking technologies located in any Agri10x Platform, application, software or similar electronic system Company-issued or Company-authorized. For more information about the cookies the Company uses, Data Subjects should consult Agri10x’s online Privacy Statement at https://www.home.agri10x.com/privacy-policy/. In order to receive further information about the cookies used in a particular Company electronic system, Data Subjects should contact info@agri10x.com.


4. MINIMUM COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA 

Agri10x limits the Personal Data it collects and Processes to the minimum amount necessary for an appropriate business purpose. Personal Data shall be Processed only by those Employees who have an authorized business purpose to Process such Personal Data (“Authorized Employees”), consistent with their roles and responsibilities. Before collecting or Processing Personal Data, Authorized Employees shall analyse whether the business purpose can be satisfied without collecting and Processing Personal Data. In many cases, anonymous (or de-identified) data (which does not identify a Data Subject and cannot be re-identified) will be sufficient. Aggregated numerical information (such as statistical survey data) which includes only anonymous data should be used for many types of reports. If the use of anonymous data is not possible, considering the purpose for which the data is being used, then pseudonymous data which cannot be attributed to a Data Subject without the use of additional information should be used. In this case, the additional information must be kept separately to ensure that the Personal Data cannot be directly linked to an identifiable individual. In those cases where the business purpose can be achieved by eliminating certain data elements, by anonymizing or aggregating data, then Authorized Employees should use all reasonable efforts to use pseudonymous data or to collect or Process the minimum amount of Personal Data necessary in order to achieve the purpose.


5. ACCURACY AND DATA SUBJECT RIGHTS 

To the extent that a Data Subject provides the Company Personal Data, including the Personal Data on a third party platform, they must (i) ensure, on a continuing basis, the accuracy, reliability, and relevancy of such Personal Data, (ii) only collect and provide the Company such Personal Data in accordance with all Laws, including when applicable, in accordance with all data processing notice and consent requirements, and (iii) inform the third parties whose Personal Data they provide to the Company, or who the third party directly provides the Company to facilitate or engage in a personal, non-business, related function, that the Company will collect and retain such Personal Data in accordance with this Policy, which may be amended from time to time. Without limiting the foregoing, Data Subjects must, promptly and without delay, notify the Company (preferably in writing) of any amendments that need to be made to Personal Data to ensure its accuracy, reliability, and relevancy, and the Company shall use reasonable efforts to keep Personal Data accurate, current and reliable for its intended use. To the extent required by Law, the Company shall use reasonable efforts to ensure that any Personal Data that are inaccurate, unreliable, or irrelevant having regard to the purposes for which they are Processed, are corrected, amended, or deleted without undue delay. 

Data Subjects may have certain rights in relation to their Personal Data under the Law. These rights are generally not absolute and may be subject to certain exceptions or qualifications. The Company will comply with Law to ensure that Data Subjects are able to exercise their rights in relation to their Personal Data. The following paragraphs describe common Data Subject rights that apply in some jurisdictions. In order to exercise those Data Subject rights, such Data Subject should contact the Company at info@agri10x.com.


6. RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION 

Personal Data shall be retained only as long as needed to meet the purposes for which it has been collected unless different retention periods apply under Law. After the Personal Data has fulfilled the purposes for which it was collected, the Personal Data should be securely deleted or destroyed, unless retention is otherwise required by Law.


7. TECHNICAL, PHYSICAL, AND ORGANIZATIONAL SAFEGUARDS 

In General: The Company protects Personal Data by applying reasonable technical, physical, and organizational safeguards designed to prevent unauthorized or unlawful access to or acquisition or disclosure of Personal Data or any accidental loss, alteration, destruction or damage to Personal Data. These safeguards take into account applicable industry standards, the practicality of the protection, and the sensitivity of the Personal Data being protected and are appropriate to the risks posed by the relevant Processing activities, including the risk of exposure to loss, theft or unauthorized use or access of Personal Data. 

Physical and Electronic Security: The Company endeavours to safeguard and protect the Data Subject’s Personal Information. When the Data Subjects make Personal Information available to the Company, their Personal Information is protected both online and offline (to the extent that we maintain any Personal Information offline). Access to their Personal Information is strictly limited, and the Company takes reasonable security measures to ensure that the Personal Information is not accessible to the public. All of the Personal Information is restricted in offices, as well as the offices of third-party service providers. Only Employees or third-party agents who need Personal Information to perform a specific job are granted access to Personal Information. The Employees are dedicated to ensuring the security and privacy of all the Personal Information. Employees not adhering to this Policy are subject to disciplinary action. The servers that the Company stores user Personal Information on are kept in a secure physical environment. Agri10x also has security measures in place to protect the loss, misuse and alteration of Personal Information under control. 

Reporting of Incidents: Data Subjects should immediately (and in any case no later than 24 hours after discovery) report any actual or suspected compromise of the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of Personal Data or the systems or databases on which the Personal Data is stored, transmitted or Processed; including, but not limited to, any breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure or acquisition of, or access to, any Personal Data (each, an “Incident”) to the Chief Privacy Officer regardless of the magnitude of the Incident or the type of Personal Data involved.


8. LAWFUL PROCESSING 

Conditions for Processing: The Company Processes Personal Data in accordance with Law. To the extent required by Law, the Company will notify Data Subjects of the legal basis on which the Company relies in order to Process their Personal Data. 

Adherence to Consent Requirements: Whenever the Company’s policies, Law, or contractual obligations require the Company to obtain consent from the Data Subject(s) for the collection, use, Processing, transfer or sharing of Personal Data, the Company shall comply with those requirements. By accessing the Platform or otherwise using the Platform, the relevant Data Subject expressly consents to Company’s collection, storage, use, Processing and disclosure of the Information in accordance with the terms of this Policy. 

Right of Revocation: Where the Company relies on consent for Processing Personal Data for a particular purpose, Data Subjects shall have the right to revoke their consent at any time, whereupon the Company shall cease Processing of the Personal Data for that purpose. The revocation of consent will not invalidate the lawfulness of Processing carried out before the revocation was made. The Company shall be entitled to continue its Processing of Personal Data if required or permitted by Law and for other purposes in relation to which the Data Subject has not revoked consent. 

Provision of Personal Data when Required: If a Data Subject refuses to provide the Company with certain Personal Data, this may hamper the Company’s ability to, or prevent the Company from being able to, furnish certain services to the Data Subject. For example, under certain circumstances, the Personal Data may be required in order for an Employee to receive, or the Company perform, necessary, critical, or statutory services (such as payroll, employment benefits, travel and expense reimbursement, tax and other human resource- related obligations), all of which will be done in accordance with the Company’s policies and Law. Where the provision of Personal Data is a statutory or contractual requirement, or a requirement necessary to enter into a contract, the Company will inform the Data Subject of this fact and of the possible consequences of not providing the Personal Data. 

Extraordinary Circumstances: In some cases, where authorized or required by Law, the Company may collect, use or disclose Personal Data without requesting consent, providing notice or offering an opportunity to object to the Processing of the Personal Data, such as in the course of an investigation of possible wrongdoing or in emergency situations. To the extent required by Law, the Company will notify the Data Subject of the Processing as soon as possible thereafter.


9. PROTECTION OF SENSITIVE PERSONAL DATA AND SENSITIVE IDENTIFICATION DATA 

Higher Level of Protection: Because of the nature of Sensitive Personal Data and Sensitive Identification Data, the Company’s policies and procedures, as well as Law in certain cases, require that a higher level of protection be applied to it compared to Personal Data that is not sensitive. 

Protection Protocols: The Company shall apply a higher level of security to Sensitive Personal Data and Sensitive Identification Data reflecting the correspondingly greater risks arising from the unlawful or unauthorized disclosure of such information. In particular: 

Any hard copies of documents or any tangible materials containing Sensitive Personal Data and Sensitive Identification Data shall be locked in a file cabinet or closet or shall be secured against unauthorized access by other means. 

Sensitive Personal Data and Sensitive Identification Data shall not be stored on removable storage media such as laptops, CDs, DVDs, USB storage devices or mobile devices (e.g., phones, tablets) unless the data is encrypted. 

Sensitive Personal Data and Sensitive Identification Data shall be encrypted at rest and in transit. 

Sensitive Personal Data and Sensitive Identification Data shall not be transferred, even temporarily, to an Employee’s home computer, an Employee’s personal email account, or any Internet website or any other unauthorized electronic equipment without the approval of the Chief Privacy Officer and, in such cases, the Sensitive Personal Data and Sensitive Identification Data shall be encrypted. 

The Company does not use Sensitive Identification Data except when absolutely required for legitimate business purposes, including, but not limited to, Employee benefits and tax purposes, when required by Law or upon prior written approval of the Chief Privacy Officer.


10. ELECTRONIC MONITORING 

To the extent permitted by Law, Agri10x reserves the right to monitor and audit Employees’ use of all Company Information Resources and the information stored on or transmitted through these Information Resources to the extent required for an appropriate business purpose (including the protection of Company property). Unless Law provides otherwise, Employees should have no expectation of privacy around their use of the Company’s Information Resources or the Personal Data they store on or transmit through these Information Resources. Any electronic monitoring of Personal Data will be conducted in accordance with Law, applicable works council or collective bargaining agreements, and with the approval of the Chief Privacy Officer. To the extent required by Law, Employees will receive notice of the scope and extent of Company’s electronic monitoring. Employees should not implement any electronic monitoring practices, including monitoring of phone calls, emails and instant messaging communications, without the prior written consent of the Chief Privacy Officer.


11. TRANSFER OF PERSONAL DATA TO A THIRD PARTY 

The Company may share Personal Data with third parties in compliance with Law. With respect to Personal Data of Data Subjects, such third parties may include other Company entities, service providers, business customers, regulated entities to which the Company provides products and/or services, entities that may acquire portions of the business, and regulatory authorities.


12. COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY 

All the Data Subjects are expected to comply with this Policy.


13. CONCERNS AND APPEALS 

The Company takes reasonable steps to permit Employees to raise concerns about the manner in which it Processes Personal Data. If an Employee has a concern about the Company’s collection or Processing of Personal Data, the Employee should notify one of the following: the Company at info@agri10x.com or the Chief Privacy Officer. A Data Subject such as a customer, FPO, farmer or trader may also raise concerns with the Company about how it Processes the Personal Data, which concerns will be addressed in an appropriate manner in accordance with Law. Agri10x shall provide and notify these subjects of an appropriate contact mechanism who has questions about the Company’s handling of Personal Data as well as, if applicable, with the contact details of the Chief Privacy Officer or any similar person responsible for the protection of their Personal Data.


14. CHANGES TO OUR PRIVACY POLICY AND PRACTICES 

The Company reserves the right to change or update this Policy at any time by posting a notice on the Platform that the Company is changing its Privacy Policy. If the manner in which it uses Personal Information changes, Agri10x will notify Data Subjects by: (a) sending the modified policy via e-mail; and/or (b) by any other reasonable means acceptable under applicable Law. The Data Subjects will have a choice as to whether or not they want to opt-in to such use.


15. RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE POLICY 

This Policy is administered by Company’s Chief Privacy Officer.


16. ANCILLARY POLICIES 

The Company may on best efforts basis adopt some of the ancillary policy that are related to this Policy such as: i) Terms of Use and ii) Information Security Policy.


17. INTERPRETATION 

The Company, in its sole discretion, reserves the exclusive right to interpret, administer and apply this Policy, to make any exceptions to it, and to change this Policy at any time and for any reason. The provisions of this Policy do not establish contractual rights, in whole or in part, between the Company and the recipient of the Policy. The Company reserves the right to modify, amend, or terminate this Policy at any time. This Policy is the property of iCognitive Global Private Limited (Agri10x) and is the recipient’s responsibility to review the intranet publication of this Policy to ensure the most current version is being referenced before taking action based on any printed copy, which may be outdated.
For any support request regards your orders or deliveries please feel free to speak with us at below
